intro: Homalium racoubea, commonly known as the racoubea huito, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Salicaceae, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its elongated, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, followed by edible, fleshy berries. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in folk medicine for their purported health benefits.
